sense.name: large flat case for carrying loose papers, pictures
sense.examples: The black leather portfolio is twice as expensive as the vinyl one. I think I left my brown portfolio on the train. They are having a sale on handbags, wallets, briefcases and portfolios.

sense.name: a set of pieces of creative work for showing
sense.commentary: PORTFOLIO[+collection][+assets][+creative] samples of artistic work, including photos of models/actors
sense.examples: The fashion model showed her portfolio to three different agencies. Sally has put together an impressive portfolio of her charcoal and pastel drawings. Sam needs to put together a portfolio of his best wedding pictures to show clients.

sense.name: a list of financial assets owned by a person or organization
sense.examples: John's financial advisor wants to re-balance his portfolio to include more growth funds. The firm's portfolio for their pension plan includes bonds and mutual funds. Sound portfolio management is essential to accumulating wealth.

sense.name: role or function of the head of a government department
sense.examples: He is currently a diplomat without portfolio. She holds the portfolio for foreign affairs.
